result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquist J Barfield

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquist J Barfield in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt Last in court for Marquist J Barfield.  Assistant District Attorney Emily S Zimmel in court for Grant Huebner for  the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.   There has not been an exchange of discovery as yet.  The defense is requesting an adjourned date for scheduling.  Case adjourned in Br 45.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquist J Barfield not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt Last in court for Marquist J Barfield.  Assistant District  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for the State of Wisconsin for Attorney Grant Huebner.  Attorney Huebner in trial in another court and unable to appear for arraignment.  Case is adjourned in Br 45.  mn
Arraignment scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marquist J Barfield appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt Last in court for Marquist J Barfield.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Stipulation to 15CF4759 agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective S. Seitz. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests an arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 45.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marquist J Barfield not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt Last appeared by video for Marquist J Barfield.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 086680,
Payable Number: 1031467,
Receipt Number: 22RP036482,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Marquist J Barfield not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with The family of victim Lee H.; JB, his sisters, and mother.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marquist J Barfield in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Marquist J Barfield in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquist J Barfield appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
